<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 6"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Spiritsight Ring](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2346)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Divination" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=47" />
<trait label="Invested" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=98" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 154 <sup>1.1</sup>, [Pathfinder #176: Lost Mammoth Valley](/Sources.aspx?ID=113) pg. 81</row>

**Price** 225 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** worn

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

The opal set in the intricately carved ivory _spiritsight ring_ eventually becomes translucent and tickles your finger whenever an [incorporeal](/Traits.aspx?ID=222) creature is nearby. When in the presence of a nearby incorporeal creature, even if it's within a solid object, you eventually detect the creature, though you might not do so instantly, and you can't pinpoint the location. This acts as a [vague sense](/Rules.aspx?ID=413), like humans' sense of smell. An incorporeal creature trying to hide its presence from this sense attempts a [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) check against your Perception DC to hide from your vague sense, as normal for attempting to foil [special senses](/Rules.aspx?ID=414). You gain a +2 item bonus when using the [Seek](/Actions.aspx?ID=84) action to find [hidden](/Conditions.aspx?ID=22) or [undetected](/Conditions.aspx?ID=39) incorporeal creatures within 30 feet of you.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
